p: The other major constituent of M. fistulosa essential oils, thymol, is a phenolic monoterpene predominantly found in thyme/oregano oil. Thymol is an isomer and shares similar biological properties with that of carvacrol [ 68, 72, 73, 74, 75, 76, 77]. We found that thymol induced a transient increase in [Ca 2+] i through rTRPA1, which is similar to the enhancement of spontaneous excitatory transmission in substantia gelatinosa neurons reported by Xu et al. [ 78]. Additionally, several other studies have demonstrated the activation of TRPA1 channels by thymol [ 79, 80, 81].
